channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-2436] jboss-fuse/fabric8 can't be built using Maven 3.2.5
item.description:
Error:

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
[INFO] Building JBoss Fuse Quickstart: camel-cxf-contract-first 1.2.0.redhat-060 (29/188)
 
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
[INFO]
 
[INFO] --- maven-clean-plugin:2.5:clean (default-clean) @ cxf-camel-cxf-contract-first ---
 
[INFO] Deleting /data/ggrzybek/sources/github.com/jboss-fuse/fabric8/quickstarts/cxf/camel-cxf-contract-first/target
 
[INFO]
 
[INFO] >>> maven-source-plugin:2.4:jar (default-cli) > generate-sources @ cxf-camel-cxf-contract-first >>>
 
[INFO]
 
[INFO] --- cxf-codegen-plugin:3.0.2.redhat-620056:wsdl2java (generate-sources) @ cxf-camel-cxf-contract-first ---
 
[WARNING] Error injecting: org.eclipse.aether.connector.wagon.WagonRepositoryConnectorFactory
 
com.google.inject.ProvisionException: Unable to provision, see the following errors:
 
 
1) No implementation for org.eclipse.aether.connector.wagon.WagonProvider was bound.
 
while locating org.eclipse.aether.connector.wagon.WagonRepositoryConnectorFactory
 
 
1 error

item.summary: jboss-fuse/fabric8 can't be built using Maven 3.2.5

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This is real problem: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MNG-5562
Recently we had only two Aethers:

  • Sonatype version (Maven 3.0)
  • Eclipse Aether 0.9 version (Maven 3.1 - 3.2.3 inclusive)

Now we have third version:

  • Eclipse Aether 1.0.0.v20140518 which changed significantly (http://wiki.eclipse.org/Aether/New_and_Noteworthy#Transporters)

Fabric8-maven-plugin uses Aether version 0.9.0.M2 and I (now) can't see simple way to make it work with both versions of Eclipse Aether...
Maven team gave us very hard riddle to solve. Moving this issue into Future.

hmm, weird...

...
 
[INFO] Fabric8 :: Integration Tests :: PaxExam (Deprecated) :: Common SUCCESS [  1.240 s]
 
[INFO] Fabric8 :: Integration Tests :: PaxExam (Deprecated) :: Basic SUCCESS [  6.056 s]
 
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
 
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
[INFO] Total time: 07:48 min
 
[INFO] Finished at: 2015-06-16T13:09:17+02:00
 
[INFO] Final Memory: 630M/1786M
 
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
✔ ~/sources/github.com/jboss-fuse/fabric8 [:af1e13a|✚ 4] 
13:09 $ mvn --version
 
Apache Maven 3.2.5 (12a6b3acb947671f09b81f49094c53f426d8cea1; 2014-12-26T11:00:09+01:00)
 
Maven home: /opt/java/tools/apache-maven-3.2.5
 
Java version: 1.7.0_80, vendor: Oracle Corporation
 
Java home: /opt/java/javase/jdk1.7.0_80/jre
 
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: UTF-8
 
OS name: "linux", version: "4.0.4-202.fc21.x86_64", arch: "amd64", family: "unix"

Maven 3.3.3:

...
 
[INFO] Fabric8 :: Integration Tests :: PaxExam (Deprecated) :: Common SUCCESS [ 46.512 s]
 
[INFO] Fabric8 :: Integration Tests :: PaxExam (Deprecated) :: Basic SUCCESS [29:23 min]
 
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
 
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
[INFO] Total time: 01:00 h
 
[INFO] Finished at: 2015-06-16T21:24:23+02:00
 
[INFO] Final Memory: 539M/1698M
 
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
✔ ~/sources/github.com/jboss-fuse/fabric8 [:af1e13a|✚ 4] 
21:24 $ mvn --version
 
Apache Maven 3.3.3 (7994120775791599e205a5524ec3e0dfe41d4a06; 2015-04-22T13:57:37+02:00)
 
Maven home: /opt/java/tools/apache-maven-3.3.3
 
Java version: 1.7.0_80, vendor: Oracle Corporation
 
Java home: /opt/java/javase/jdk1.7.0_80/jre
 
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: UTF-8
 
OS name: "linux", version: "4.0.4-202.fc21.x86_64", arch: "amd64", family: "unix"

This fix:

diff --git a/fabric8-maven-plugin/pom.xml b/fabric8-maven-plugin/pom.xml
 
index e1d86dc..e393556 100644
 
--- a/fabric8-maven-plugin/pom.xml
 
+++ b/fabric8-maven-plugin/pom.xml
 
@@ -114,6 +114,12 @@
 
     <dependency>
 
         <groupId>io.fabric8</groupId>
 
         <artifactId>fabric-project-deployer</artifactId>
 
+        <exclusions>
 
+            <exclusion>
 
+                <groupId>org.eclipse.aether</groupId>
 
+                <artifactId>aether-connector-wagon</artifactId>
 
+            </exclusion>
 
+        </exclusions>
 
     </dependency>
 
     <dependency>
 
         <groupId>io.fabric8</groupId>

is neither a joke nor a blind shot...

Excluding org.eclipse.aether:aether-connector-wagon:0.9.0.M2 from the plugin's dependencies removes the SISU/Guice component org.eclipse.aether.connector.wagon.WagonRepositoryConnectorFactory from a list of available components during a build. This was problem under Mavens which use different version of Aether (Maven 3.2.5 uses Aether 1.0.0.v20140518 and Maven 3.3.3 uses Aether 1.0.2.v20150114).
The real cause of the problem was the declaration, that org.eclipse.aether.connector.wagon.WagonRepositoryConnectorFactory is an implementation of org.eclipse.aether.spi.connector.RepositoryConnectorFactory:

@Named
 
@Component( role = RepositoryConnectorFactory.class, hint = "wagon" )
 
public final class WagonRepositoryConnectorFactory
 
    implements RepositoryConnectorFactory, Service
 
{

which simply wasn't true under Maven with newer Aether. The problem occurred in different situations - when Aether was supposed to dowload/resolve new artifacts.
Simply excluding this particular version of aether from the dependencies of fabric8-maven-plugin is enough to build Fabric8 (or any project which uses fabric8-maven-plugin) under Mavens 3.2.5 and later.

So now, when during a build there's a need to download/resolve artifacts, the aether from Maven installation is used. And it works as expected.

But why fabric8-maven-plugin works anyway? Yes, I've checked it under 3.2.3, 3.2.5 and 3.3.3. fabric8-maven-plugin (either "deploy" or "verify-features" goals) uses Aether in version 0.9.0.M2, but it doesn't conflict with what Maven provides, because:

  • it uses it in non-IOC style
  • it uses this library packaged inside fabric-maven JAR / bundle

Phew. That's it. You can now use any Maven you like

Jira needs a +1 or Like button for cases like this!

Good job!
Resolved here in 6.2.1 branch of Fabric8 (not 6.2.0).

Now we have:

Exception in thread "pool-2-thread-1" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.eclipse.aether.spi.connector.Transfer.setState(Lorg/eclipse/aether/spi/connector/Transfer$State;)Lorg/eclipse/aether/spi/connector/Transfer;
 
	at org.eclipse.aether.connector.wagon.WagonRepositoryConnector$GetTask.run(WagonRepositoryConnector.java:608)
 
	at org.eclipse.aether.util.concurrency.RunnableErrorForwarder$1.run(RunnableErrorForwarder.java:67)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
 
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

during fabric8-maven-plugin:1.2.0-SNAPSHOT:verify-features
